    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

      • readNumberOfBanks

        public static int readNumberOfBanks(java.util.Scanner input)
        Returns the number of banks retrieved by the user's input.
        • If the number of banks is less than 1, the user must reenter the number of banks until it is greater than 0.
        Parameters:
        input - simple text scanner used to parse the number of banks
        Returns:
        the number of banks

      • readLimit

        public static double readLimit(java.util.Scanner input)
        Returns the bank minimum balance limit retrieved by the user's input.

        The limit is represented in million dollars. So a limit of 1 is a limit of a million dollars.

        • If the limit is not greater than 0.0, the user must reenter the limit until it is greater than 0.0.
        Parameters:
        input - simple text scanner used to parse the bank minimum balance limit
        Returns:
        the bank minimum balance limit

      • fillTwoDimensionalArray

        public static void fillTwoDimensionalArray(double[][] arrays,
                                           double value)
        Fills all elements of the given double two-dimensional array argument with the double value.
        Parameters:
        arrays - the array to be filled
        value - the value to be stored in all elements of the array

      • readBanksBalancesAndBorrowers

        public static void readBanksBalancesAndBorrowers(double[] banksBalances,
                                                 double[][] borrowers,
                                                 java.util.Scanner input)
        Retrieves every banks' balance and their borrowers' IDs and borrow amounts from the user's input.
        • If the number of rows and columns of the borrowers array is not equal to the banksBalances array's size, an error will be displayed.
        Parameters:
        banksBalances - array of each bank's balance
        borrowers - array of loans each bank gave to the other bank(s)
        input - simple text scanner used to parse each bank's balance and their borrowers' IDs and borrow amounts

      • findUnsafeBanks

        public static java.lang.String findUnsafeBanks(double[] banksBalances,
                                               double[][] borrowers,
                                               double limit)
        Returns which banks are unsafe given the double two-dimensional array argument, double array argument, and the double value.
        • If the limit is not greater than 0.0, it will default to 1.0.
        • If the number of rows of the borrowers array is not equal to the banksBalances array's size, then an empty string is returned.
        • If any of the banks have negative balance, they will default to 0.0.
        • If any of the loans are negative, they will default to -1.0.
        Parameters:
        banksBalances - array of each bank's balance
        borrowers - array of loans each bank gave to the other bank(s)
        limit - the bank minimum balance limit
        Returns:
        the unsafe banks
